critique: The document pertains to the authority of the Governor of the Panama Canal to grant pardons, paroles, and reprieves for offenses against the laws, orders, and regulations of the Canal Zone. It outlines a process involving a pardon board of five members designated by the governor, requiring written approval from the majority for any pardon, parole, reprieve, or commutation of sentence.The document does not directly address ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, most of the scores are neutral.
